alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:56PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wichita, southeastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties through 530 PM MDT/630 PM CDT/... At 455 PM MDT/555 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Sharon Springs to 8 miles north of Leoti. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Wichita, southeastern Wallace, southwestern Logan and northeastern Greeley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
